Thomas Edison, creator of the popular lightbulb, had this to say about traditional education: "The present system does not give elasticity to the mind. It casts the brain into a mold. The result of accepting unrelated facts is the fostering of conservatism [in thinking]. It breeds fear, and from fear comes ignorance."

In contrast to the schooling of the past, Edison noted that Montessori education ‚Äúmakes learning a pleasure. It follows the natural instincts of the human being.‚Äù

Chopsticks, or kuaizi in Chinese, are a pair of small equal-length tapered sticks, usually made of wood, used for eating food. It is believed the first chopsticks were developed over 5,000 years ago in China. The earliest evidence of a pair of chopsticks made out of bronze was excavated from the Ruins of Yin near Anyang, Henan province, dating back to roughly 1,200 BC.

The Larkspur Campus has been learning about Chinese culture as we enter the Chinese New Year in the Year of the Rat. The chopsticks definitely tested our students fine-motor skills and dexterity.

Our goal for this restaurant was to create a sustainable healthy and resourceful environment. Throughout this week we were aspiring to build a zero waste and sustainable restaurant that brings our community and our families together to change our part of the world. Through each and every piece of food that we serve, we guarantee that no food, tools, or ideas will go to waste. We have reused multiple items over the course of this week in our restaurant, such as recycled T-shirts for the waiters, cardboard, paper and many other reusable items. We are gathering together to help one another by inspiring change in the form of a restaurant. Thank you for dining with us, and we hope you enjoy your meal.

A big thanks and congratulations is due to Ms. Kurbat, Ms. Sandler, and Ms. Maike for the seamless execution of this day.

British-born Constance Mary Katherine Applebee was a very weak child who noticed that she felt better if she was active, contradicting the widely held belief that women were too frail to exercise. Applebee came to the United States in 1901 at age 29 to take a course at Harvard and it was there that she first showed her American peers the British sport of field hockey. It was such a hit that she started touring women‚Äôs colleges to introduce them to the sport and co-founded the American Field Hockey Association. Applebee served as the athletic director at Bryn Mawr College from 1904 through 1928 and became a naturalized American citizen. She was born #OnThisDay in 1873, was an active coach into her 90s, and lived to the age of 107. #HappyBirthday
